description: Primes base 10 that remain primes in five bases b, 2<=b<=10, expansions interpreted as decimal numbers.
links: Sebastian Petzelberger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
C. Rivera, PP&P Puzzle 24: Primes in several bases
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range@ 1800], Count[PrimeQ /@ Table[FromDigits[IntegerDigits[#, i]], {i, 2, 10}], True] == 5 &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 20 2015, after _Harvey P. Dale_ at A052032 *)
prog: (PARI) lista(nn, nb=5) = {forprime(p=2, nn, if (sum(b=2, 10, isprime(subst(Pol(digits(p, b)), x, 10))) == nb, print1(p, ", ")););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 21 2015
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Dec 15 1999
